intro: Maihueniopsis conoidea, commonly known as the Andean sunflower, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its yellow composite flowers and hairy stems. The plant thrives in high-altitude environments, often growing in rocky or alpine regions. It has small, alternate leaves that are typically covered in fine pubescence. Maihueniopsis conoidea is adapted to harsh climatic conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
